fields.description:
The following are the steps to reproduce this issue: 

1) Go to the Navigator 

2) Identify a host group, or create one, such that it only has one unhandled down host 

3) Click the 'Unhandled' pill on the level of this host group so that Navigator is now filtered to just show this host group and its unhandled down host 

4) Change the state of the unhandled down host to be 'UP' or 'UNREACHABLE' so that it becomes handled

5) Attempt to expand out the 'NO HOSTGROUPS' host group that appears which originally was the host group identified in step 2

Expected Result: After step 4, the host group should no longer be filtered (or equivalent). 

After step 5, the host group should expand out show a list of all of its hosts as it usually does (or equivalent).

Actual Result: After step 4, the host group name changes to 'NO HOSTGROUPS'. After step 5, the host group does not expand, and a permanent load mask occurs after which a browser refresh must be carried out.

Please see screenshot attached.
fields.summary: 'NO HOSTGROUPS' and permanent load mask appearing in Navigator

fields.description:
The following are the steps to reproduce this issue: 

1) Go to the Navigator 

2) Enter an invalid auto- select URL in the address bar of the browser to search for a service check, for example, http://192.168.16.147/monitoring/#!?autoSelectHost=opsview&autoSelectService=Connectivity%20-%20, and press the return key on the keyboard 

Expected Result: After step 2, no error dialog should be generated, no error should be generated in the console, and the service check investigate modal window should simply not appear. It should also then be possible for the user to correct the auto-select URL, press the return key again, and this time see the service check investigate modal window appear for the service check that has been searched for.

Actual Result: After step 2, the following error dialog is generated: 

No object found

And the following error is generated in the console:

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '0' of null

It is then not possible to correct the auto-select URL and try again; a browser refresh of the Navigator must first be carried out, and only then can the corrected auto-select URL can be tried.
fields.summary: Navigator: Entering invalid auto-select URL requires browser refresh

fields.description:
Attempting to access the config window by clicking the config icon on the old Event Table dashlet results in the following error being generated in the console: 

Error: Ext.Loader is not enabled, so dependencies cannot be resolved dynamically. Missing required class: DSHB.view.dashletConfigs.ViewportSummaryConfig 

Attempting then to cancel out of the config window on the new Event Table dashlet (after the user clicks on the config icon on the new Event Table dashlet) by clicking on the 'Cancel' button generates the following error in the console: 

TypeError: b is null

Another way to reproduce this issue is to simply click 'Cancel' on the config window on the Event Table dashlet without making any changes on the window.

This has been seen intially with commercial-dashboardNG-5.2 build 5.2.0.161271530, on Firefox version 46.0.1, on debian 8 (and also on rhel 7), on Windows 10. 

Please see screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Console errors generated when accessing config windows on Event Table dashlet

fields.description:
The following are the steps to reproduce this issue: 

1) Go to the Host Groups, Hosts and Service Checks page 

2) Filter on a handled or unhandled host group 

3) Click on the handled or unhandled host group column until the 'Filters' option is visible 

4) Hover over the 'Filters' option 

5) Deselect the select all check box 

6) Deselect any check box ticked 

Expected Result: After step 5, the select all check box should be unticked, any check boxes should be unticked, and any filtering applied on the host group should be cleared.

Actual Result: After step 5, the select all check box is unticked, however any check boxes remain ticked, and the filtering applied on the host group is not cleared. 

After step 6, the filtering applied on the host group is not cleared (unticking a check box first, i.e. 'DOWN', 'UP', etc without first unticking the select all check box removes the filtering applied on the host group as expected).
fields.summary: Unticking 'Select All' filter on host group filtering breaks filtering

fields.description:
The following are the steps to reproduce this issue: 

1) Go to the Host Groups, Hosts and Service Checks page 

2) Filter on a handled or unhandled host group 

3) Click on the handled or unhandled host group column until the 'Filters' option is visible 

4) Hover over the 'Filters' option 

5) Deselect the select all check box 

6) Deselect any check box ticked 

Expected Result: After step 5, the select all check box should be unticked, any check boxes should be unticked, and any filtering applied on the host group should be cleared.

Actual Result: After step 5, the select all check box is unticked, however any check boxes remain ticked, and the filtering applied on the host group is not cleared. 

After step 6, the filtering applied on the host group is not cleared (unticking a check box first, i.e. 'DOWN', 'UP', etc without first unticking the select all check box removes the filtering applied on the host group as expected).
fields.summary: Unticking 'Select All' filter on host group filtering breaks filtering

comments.body:
Had a discussion with Ton as to how to progress with the fix as the code that I've delved into seems to be in a different format than to the one we abide by.
Seems like an opportunity to rewrite the code in the approach that we use in most other places to minimise inconsistency.

Need to talk to Adam about whether
* we can implement Filter Window in here (if its appropriate)
* if it's okay to rewrite etc
* if it's okay to get rid of searching of the column 'description' seeing as the API doesn't support it.

Spoken with Adam and he agrees with all 3 points above as well as adding another functionality into the page.

* Pagination

Will have a technical discussion with Ton on the solution

Have devised a solution as shown in the pirate pad link: http://piratepad.net/3LfiaKPkyE

Will analyse with Ton on whether the suggested approach is appropriate and/or how it could be improved.
Having discussed with [~adam.such@opsview.com] we have decided to park this on the backlog due to the size of the work.

||AllProblems||Hashtags List||
|Pagination|No Pagination|
|Default refresh button within bar|Custom implemented refresh button|
|Top Toolbar|No Top Toolbar - custom implemented toolbar|
|dropdown buttons|Custom implemented dropdown button|
|reset view button|No reset view button|
|Filter Window|No Filter Window|
|Sorting|Sorting|
|--|List & Grid View Buttons|

Controllers:
  * HashtagMainController, inherit from GridRefresh base
  * HashtagsList, inherit from GridRefreshBase
  * HashtagsDetail,inherit GridRefreshBase

Views:
  * GridRefreshBase
  * HashtagsListNew
  * HashtagsDetailNew
    * ovIncludeFilterWindow: false, or an object which is its configuration passed to FilterWindow
       When clicked, Ext.create("FilterWindow", me.ovIncludeFilterWindow)
    * add pagination

STEPS

1. UI change:
Remove custom refresh button and implement default pagination toolbar
Implement the rest of the view buttons; list & grid view
Add filter options button
Add reset view button
Add in the string searching functionality within hashtags tab > FilterWindow ("Or search hashtag")

2. Controller Logic
Seperate out logic for hastag list and hashtag details into 2 separate files.
Convert the initial load sequence to doing an afterrender/ovCardActivate event listener on HashtagsGridScreen -which will then check if screen is active to determine refreshtimer logic
Add in refreshaction listener which fires a function for loading hashtags
        loadHashtags: function() {
           if (activeScreen !=== hashtags) {
               stop refresh timer
            }
            add relevant parameters & sorters to store
            setloading mask
            // Check store.load
            // Below will always change the page to be page 1
            //When Filterwindow is applied or ResetView, store.currentPage=1, and then like refresh button pressed
            // Check with Adam re: 5.1
            store.loadPage(1,  store.currentPage
             {
                callback: function(store, operation) {
                    remove loadingmask
                    if (callback) {
                        callback(operation)
                    }
                }
        }

Filter Options Window logic
Alter the existing logic to allow search strings for hashtags tab
' #showFilterOptions': {
                click: me.onFilterOptionsButtonClick
                    - Will retrive the params saved in config to see if filters applied
                    - restore previous selection
            },
filterwindow#apply': {
                click: me.onHashtagsFilterApplyButtonClick
                    - which will save the users selection into the params {} in the config
                    - Fire the loading functions for hashtags
            },
' #reset': {
                click: me.onHashtagsFilterReset
                    set the params {} in the config to be empty
            },

PageSize change logic

* REST API change for
  * pagination
  * hashtag substring search

Tasking:


Hashtags:

- View files - 5h
- Controller files - 5h
- Store view refactoring - 3h 
- Filter options window - 3h
- View logic - 2h 
- Pagniation - 1h
- DevTest - 4h
- REST API change - 2h
- Test case updates - 1 hour
- Testing - 4hours
- Backend - 8 hours 

Problems
- Roll out - 8 hours
- Testing - 4 hours
Added steps for Development http://piratepad.net/HeN2xfa3fp

1) This code:

+                // I have used this here to create the sub string search
+                // for the hashtags. This is different to the way it has been
+                // done in the AllProblems controller. They actually set the
+                // API Params in a seperate function see getApiParams in
+                // All problems.

I thought we said this needed to be in the Hashtags controller because hashtag_search wasn't getting loaded back?

2) In applyStateHashtagsList(), good "fail early" with Ext.Object.isEmpty(state).

3) There is missing "filters" upgrading. There should be a bit of code to migrate existing filters into the filter window params. See app/controller/AllProblems.js around:

// Compatibility for old filters...
        if (state.filters) {

4) I think there is a bug here:

-        callback({
-            success: true
-        });

After a refresh occurs, the timer button is left disabled. This should be added into the store.reload()'s callbacks

fields.description:
The following are the steps to reproduce this issue: 

1) Filter on a host group for a user A and get the share view URL link 

2) Log out and log in as user B who doesn't have access to the host group in step 1 

3) When the share view URL is re-directed to, remove the filtering applied on the host group by unticking the check box that has been ticked on the 'Filters' drop- down 

4) Click on the breadcrumb link to go back to the Host Groups, Hosts & Service Checks page to see all of the host groups and hosts 

5) Hover over the refresh button so that the timer appears 

Expected Result: After step 5, after the timer counts down to 0, the Host Groups, Hosts & Service Checks page should refresh just once. 

Actual Result: After step 5, when the time reaches around 2 or 3 seconds (this is variable), a refresh occurs. And then when the time reaches 0, the actual refresh that is supposed to take place, occurs. 

It is not clear why the first refresh is happening but it has been seen only while following the steps to reproduce, and not ordinarily when just waiting for the auto-refresh to occur.

fields.description:
At present when logged in our downloads page is fairly confusing to a user unless you know exactly what you are doing. The user is presented with numerous tabs, and links without necessary knowing what and which order they need to do things. We need to simplify this as much as possible. 

Furthermore it is extremely time consuming for web admins to update download links (as well as being prone to human error) as this is done manually in HTML. 

Attached is a wire frame of the redesigned downloads page. 

*Back end for admins*
-Ideally new download links can be copy pasted straight into admin fields for specific versions and technologies. E.g. "Opsview Atom" or "Ubunutu 6.2" making the upload process quicker and more accurate. 

*For users*
-Choose edition/OS are pick list drop downs dependent on the fields we have available
-The main variable is dependent on whether 'Own linux' is selected as a method on the first box. No platform will be required and the download link should be replaced with two options (manual, or auto install) with some help text. Some logic will be required here. 

*Nice to have*
To minimise page length it may be nice to have a Slave tab on the Opsview Monitor box with some static downloads if users need to scale and monitor large environments.

fields.description:
In the Mass Action modals performance is impacted when attempting to render the manual selection grid with a large amount of objects.

When 1,000 or more objects are selected an exclamation mark symbol in a warning triangle should be shown on the Manual Selection section accordion with a tool tip:
"Warning: You have selected a large number of objects, this may cause a slow down in the display of the Manual Selection list" 

When 10,000 or more objects are selected an exclamation mark symbol in a "stop" circle should be shown on the Manual Selection section accordion with a tool tip:
"Manual selection is not available for over 10,000 objects, please reduce the number of objects selected" 
The accordion should be disabled so the user can not open it until less objects are selected.

fields.description:
The following are the steps to reproduce this issue: 

1) Filter on a host group for a user A and get the share view URL link 

2) Log out and log in as user B who doesn't have access to the host group in step 1 

3) When the share view URL is re-directed to, remove the filtering applied on the host group by unticking the check box that has been ticked on the 'Filters' drop- down 

4) Click on the breadcrumb link to go back to the Host Groups, Hosts & Service Checks page to see all of the host groups and hosts 

5) Hover over the refresh button so that the timer appears 

Expected Result: After step 5, after the timer counts down to 0, the Host Groups, Hosts & Service Checks page should refresh just once. 

Actual Result: After step 5, when the time reaches around 2 or 3 seconds (this is variable), a refresh occurs. And then when the time reaches 0, the actual refresh that is supposed to take place, occurs. 

It is not clear why the first refresh is happening but it has been seen only while following the steps to reproduce, and not ordinarily when just waiting for the auto-refresh to occur.

fields.description:
In the Mass Action modals performance is impacted when attempting to render the manual selection grid with a large amount of objects.

When 1,000 or more objects are selected an exclamation mark symbol in a warning triangle should be shown on the Manual Selection section accordion with a tool tip:
"Warning: You have selected a large number of objects, this may cause a slow down in the display of the Manual Selection list" 

When 10,000 or more objects are selected an exclamation mark symbol in a "stop" circle should be shown on the Manual Selection section accordion with a tool tip:
"Manual selection is not available for over 10,000 objects, please reduce the number of objects selected" 
The accordion should be disabled so the user can not open it until less objects are selected.

fields.description:
The following are the steps to reproduce this issue: 

1) Go to the Host Groups, Hosts & Service Checks page 

2) In the address bar of the browser, enter the following auto-select URL: 

http://192.168.16.141/monitoring/#!?autoSelectHost=opsview&autoSelectService=Connectivity%20-% 

3) Press the return key on the keyboard 

4) Click on the URL in the address bar so that it all gets highlighted 

5) Press the return key on the keyboard 

6) Press the back button in the browser (this has been seen on Chrome at least)

Expected Result: After step 3, no error should be generated in the console. 

After step 5, no error should be generated in the console. 

Actual Result: After step 3, the following error is generated in the console: 

Uncaught URIError: URI malformed

After step 5, the navigator breaks and the following error is generated in the console: 

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'dom' of null

After step 6, the following error is generated in the console: 

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'removeCls' of undefined

In order to get back to the unbroken state of the Navigator, a browser refresh must be carried out. 

Please see screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Navigator: Attempting to navigate to invalid auto-select URL breaks navigator

The following are the steps to reproduce this issue: 

1) Click on a host pill (either with filtering on a host group or not filtering on one) so that its check box is ticked and its service checks are added to the 'Checker' pane 

2) Click on the share view icon 

3) When the share view modal window appears, copy the share view URL 

4) Paste the share view URL into a new tab in the browser 

5) Press the return key on the keyboard 

Expected Result: After step 5, the host that had its host pill clicked should have its check box ticked and have all of its service checks added to the 'Checker' pane, and the 'Reset View' symbol should appear both in the host group navigator and in the 'Checker' pane. 

Actual Result: After step 5, the host that had its host pill clicked has its check box ticked and has all of its service checks added to the 'Checker' pane, but the 'Reset View' symbol doesn't appear in the host group navigator, it only appears in the 'Checker' pane.

comments.body:
This is related to OP-15107.

Amended the fix version as this code is only in develop branch, not in BRAN-5.1. Needs more investigation and possibly a better fix.
Have reverted a7d1ba212ebe63465196abee65f70805e51da909 in commit 2d51f8115a20ae0e101134620fb3ef3f337b19b5 so we can investigate unit tests further

Have applied a7d1ba212ebe63465196abee65f70805e51da909  in commit f3d3d85d5099863de30f9d317df80bbba718df04 again. Need to run the unit tests to know where this warning is coming from. Have tried executing opsview_rest --username=admin --password=initial -G --pretty GET status/bsmservice"?component_detail=1" and opsview_rest --username=admin --password=initial -G --pretty GET status/bsmcomponent"?bsid=3" but I can't get the warning message.

Spoke with Adam. The REST API is ordering appropriately now. Have put a private note in CHANGES about the warning message above.

The dashlet also has a "Clear sorting" menu option which resets the sorting. This looks like it achieves the effect of defaulting to the priority order defined in the BSM configuration. 

Marking this to Adam to confirm is okay and then he can pass to QA for testing. !Screen Shot bsm menu.png|thumbnail!

Can you please add this icon to the clear sorting option:

http://fontawesome.io/icon/times/

Other than that it looks good.

comments.body:
This is related to OP-15107.

Amended the fix version as this code is only in develop branch, not in BRAN-5.1. Needs more investigation and possibly a better fix.
Have reverted a7d1ba212ebe63465196abee65f70805e51da909 in commit 2d51f8115a20ae0e101134620fb3ef3f337b19b5 so we can investigate unit tests further

Have applied a7d1ba212ebe63465196abee65f70805e51da909  in commit f3d3d85d5099863de30f9d317df80bbba718df04 again. Need to run the unit tests to know where this warning is coming from. Have tried executing opsview_rest --username=admin --password=initial -G --pretty GET status/bsmservice"?component_detail=1" and opsview_rest --username=admin --password=initial -G --pretty GET status/bsmcomponent"?bsid=3" but I can't get the warning message.

Spoke with Adam. The REST API is ordering appropriately now. Have put a private note in CHANGES about the warning message above.

The dashlet also has a "Clear sorting" menu option which resets the sorting. This looks like it achieves the effect of defaulting to the priority order defined in the BSM configuration. 

Marking this to Adam to confirm is okay and then he can pass to QA for testing. !Screen Shot bsm menu.png|thumbnail!

Can you please add this icon to the clear sorting option:

http://fontawesome.io/icon/times/

Other than that it looks good.
Icon added:  !Screen Shot 2016-07-25 at 14.12.11.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
The following are the steps to reproduce this issue: 

1) Go to the Hashtags Summary page as an admin user 

2) Click on the contextual menu of a hashtag 

3) Click on the 'Schedule Downtime' option 

4) When the 'hashtag-name: Schedule Downtime' window appears, enter a valid start date and time, and enter an end date and time that is before the start date and time 

5) Enter a comment

6) Tick a check box on the 'Status Selection' accordion 

7) Click the 'Submit' button 

8) When the error dialog appears, click the 'OK' button 

Expected Result: After step 8, the focus should return to the 'hashtag-name: Schedule Downtime' window. 

Actual Result: After step 8, a permanent load mask is generated and the following error is generated in the console: 

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot set property 'includehosts' of undefined

Please see screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Hashtags: Clicking 'OK' on validation error generates permanent load mask

Create a temporary unknown service check for a Host that has a critical service check
Apply a Mass Re-Check on that temporary unknown Service Check

Expected:
Unknown status should revert back to Critical

Actual:
Unknown status is permanently stationed instead of Critical being reverted.

AC:

Temporary status is reverted back to Critical from a Host Service Check.
fields.summary: Clicking mass re-check for temporary unknown services

fields.description:
The following are the steps to reproduce this issue: 

1) Go to the Hashtags Summary page as an admin user 

2) Click on the contextual menu of a hashtag 

3) Click on the 'Schedule Downtime' option 

4) When the 'hashtag-name: Schedule Downtime' window appears, enter a valid start date and time, and enter an end date and time that is before the start date and time 

5) Enter a comment

6) Tick a check box on the 'Status Selection' accordion 

7) Click the 'Submit' button 

8) When the error dialog appears, click the 'OK' button 

Expected Result: After step 8, the focus should return to the 'hashtag-name: Schedule Downtime' window. 

Actual Result: After step 8, a permanent load mask is generated and the following error is generated in the console: 

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot set property 'includehosts' of undefined

Please see screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Hashtags: Clicking 'OK' on validation error generates permanent load mask

fields.description:
Split the Monitoring Server page into two tabs: Configured Monitoring Servers and 

Pending Collector Registrations

It will have a gird showing the collectors with the following columns:

* Host Name
* IP 
* OS
* Status 
* Assigned Host 

* Assigned ones are not coloured
* Removed ones are red
* Unregistered ones are orange
* The page will poll every 20 seconds to shows new collectors 

We need a way of associating hosts to a collector, we need to be able to add a collector as a host 

Alex to send the collector flow registration diagram to Adam

Review:
Change unregistered "status" column to "Registered"
Swap tabs, Registration then Clusters
Clicking "Nodes" (To be changed to "collectors") opens up list of collectors in Cluster, these are clickable taking you to Collectors
Separate story (3pts):
Collector registration option gives you a "Add to Cluster menu" with drop down options list "Add new" then all clusters. Selecting add new takes you to the clusters page with the modal opened, selecting an existing cluster just makes the settings change.
fields.summary: As an Opsview Monitor user I want to be able to register my Collectors

fields.description:
Please see attached spreadsheet on the Technologies tab for those that should be appearing on the technologies page. 

*1)* Not all stickied Opspacks are pulling through to the view. E.G. as on spreadsheet there are 8 Application type and only 3 showing. This is the same for Network and OS. 
*2)* Cloud does not show at all despite having two Opspack Stickied 
*3)* The HRs for Application, Cloud etc should link through to a Solr styled results page for those type of Opspacks. Currently we go [https://uat.opsview.com/opspack-type/application|http://example.com].   I'm not sure which page this is. Should probably be hidden from the user. I may be able to do this in the content?  
*4)* As per wireframe we need to add some link/text field at the bottom of each section 1 for 'Show Me More' linking to a Solr search result on those types. The other 'Visit Marketplace' to the Marketplace 

5) In the admin for these can they be changed from weighting priority to drag and drop.

fields.description:
The following are the steps to reproduce this issue: 

1) On the Host Groups, Hosts and Service Checks page in the Monitoring app, Identify a service check that has some performance data such that the graph icon has appeared next to in the 'Checker' pane 

2) Delete the performance data for this service check manually on the back end by deleting the 'value.rrd' file in 

/usr/local/nagios/var/rrd/<hostname>/<servicename>/<metric>/

3) Back on the Host Groups, Hosts and Service Checks page, carry out a browser reload 

4) Add the service check to the 'Checker' pane once again 

5) Click on the graph icon next to the service check or open up its investigate modal window by clicking on the 'Investigate' option on its contextual menu, and then click on the 'Graph' tab 

Expected Result: After step 5, the 'Graph' tab on the service check's investigate modal window should appear with the message 'No data yet.' 

Actual Result: After step 5, the 'Graph' tab on the service check's investigate modal window appears with the message 'No data yet', however the following error is also generated in the console: 

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'enable' of undefined
fields.summary: Console error generated when no perf data for service check on Graph tab

fields.description:
After discussion with Adam, there is a potential problem where upgrading Opsview will overwrite plugins that have been installed from the marketplace.

The old rule was that plugins from the Opspack would always be installed.

The new rule is that plugins from an Opspack will only get installed if it passes version testing.

Documented at https://secure.opsview.com/confluence/display/ENG/Opspack+technical+information
fields.summary: Opspack installation rules change for plugin

comments.body:
CHANGES entry: Plugins from Opspacks will now only install if the Opspack version is higher than the currently installed version. The old behaviour was to always install the plugin OP-16730

Pushed to develop.

fields.description:
Cannot manually remove acknowledgement for acknowledged host that is "down" or "unreachable" on "Investigate" screen on host.

Requires unhandled down or unreachable host.
On host, from hamburger select "Mass acknowledgement".
Tick the 1 "down" box for that host (only available selection) and enter some text as comment.
Shortly after Opsview moves host to "handled" section.
Find said host, select "Investigate" from hamburger.
On the info tab (default), 4th line click on "Acknowledged [trash can symbol]".
Click yes to confirmation.
Error - Opsview Web Exception - "No objects chosen for acknowledgements".
fields.summary: Cannot remove acknowledgement from a host

fields.description:
Attempting to upgrade from 5.0.2 to 5.2.x on debian 8 succeeds, with all processes reported to be running by doing an opsview_watchdog summary, however there are points during which the upgrade hangs, sometimes taking 4- 5 mins to finish. 

These specific points are shown by the following output taken from the terminal during the upgrade: 


{code:java}
Waiting for opsview-core services to stop
Unpacking opsview-core (5.2.0.161590959-1jessie1) over (5.0.2.27469-1jessie1) ...
Preparing to unpack .../opsview-web_5.2.0.161590959-1jessie1_amd64.deb ...
Unmonitoring opsview-web before stop
Stopping opsview-web: done
Unmonitoring opsview-web before upgrade

Not running
Unpacking opsview-web (5.2.0.161590959-1jessie1) over (5.0.2.27469-1jessie1) ...
Preparing to unpack .../opsview_5.2.0.161590959-1jessie1_amd64.deb ...
Unpacking opsview (5.2.0.161590959-1jessie1) over (5.0.2.27469-1jessie1) ...
Setting up opsview-watchdog (1.0.0.161450838-1jessie1) ...
Starting all services

Setting up opsview-timeseries-lib (1.0.0.161550941-1jessie1) ...
Setting up opsview-timeseries (1.0.0.161550939-1jessie1) ...
Configuring Opsview Timeseries
Reinitializing opsview-monit daemon

......................................................................................................................................................Failed to communicate with Opsview Watchdog Daemon
Setting up opsview-timeseries-enqueuer (1.0.0.161550942-1jessie1) ...
Configuring Opsview Timeseries
Reinitializing opsview-monit daemon

.......................................................


Setting up opsview-external (1.0.0.161551505-1jessie1) ...
Setting up opsview-timeseries-rrd (1.0.0.161550947-1jessie1) ...
Configuring Opsview Timeseries RRD
Reinitializing opsview-monit daemon

...........................................................................................

Reinitializing opsview-monit daemon

.........................................................................................

Setting up opsview-core (5.2.0.161590959-1jessie1) ...
{code}

The issues in the output above are: 

1) The hanging that occurs during 'Reinitializing opsview-monit daemon' 

2) The 'Reinitializing opsview-monit daemon' part occurs 5 times overall, why is this? 

3) There is an error with the 'Failed to communicate with Opsview Watchdog Daemon' 

Please see log file attached.

{code}
Base branch: develop

Good removal of boxready event.

Asking Arvind re: language string differences
Have asked Arvind to check in German and Spanish to confirm layout is okay with different length strings

I checked against german and spanish and made some tweaks to fix the layout. Unfortunately the gap that was removed at the bottom of the window was there in order to support additional line wrapping for german and spanish language - so I have re-instated that gap.

In order to remove the gap we would need to rework the layout of the window to implement "fit" layout (instead of fixed heights), or to change the widths of labels and elements so that these don't line-break for the different languages.

This would take more time so it made sense to commit the current work and allow for the decision to be made whether it is worth the effort to remove the gap at the bottom of the window.

status.name: Open

fields.description:
The following are the steps to reproduce this issue: 

1) On the Host Groups, Hosts and Service Checks page, identify a service check, which you know to have gone through various state changes, or change its state yourself to various different states such as 'CRITICAL', 'WARNING', etc, and add it to the 'Checker' pane 

2) On the contextual menu of the service check, click on the 'Investigate' option 

3) When the service check investigate modal window appears for the service check, click on the 'Events' tab 

4) Click on one of the event bars on the graph so that it is added to the 'Checker' pane 

5) Click on the event bar again so that it is removed from the 'Checker' pane 

6) Bring up the 'Checker' pane that gets minimised after step 5 

7) Click on the drop- down in 'Status' column 

8) On the 'Filters' drop-down, tick a state check box that doesn't correspond to one of the event bars clicked on in step 4, i.e. if you click on a 'CRITICAL' event bar in step 4, tick any state check box other than 'CRITICAL'

9) Un-tick the selection made in step 8 

Expected Result: After step 9, the 'Checker' pane should not contain any events. 

Actual Result: After step 9, the 'Checker' pane contains various events that should not be there. 

This is a regression as it doesn't occur in 5.1
fields.summary: SC Investigate modal window: issues with filters on Events tab 'Checker' pane

4) Click on one of the event bars on the graph so that it is added to the 'Checker' pane 

5) Click on the event bar again so that it is removed from the 'Checker' pane 

6) Bring up the 'Checker' pane that gets minimised after step 5 

7) Click on the drop- down in 'Status' column 

8) On the 'Filters' drop-down, tick a state check box that doesn't correspond to one of the event bars clicked on in step 4, i.e. if you click on a 'CRITICAL' event bar in step 4, tick any state check box other than 'CRITICAL'

9) Un-tick the selection made in step 8 

Expected Result: After step 9, the 'Checker' pane should not contain any events. 

Actual Result: After step 9, the 'Checker' pane contains various events that should not be there. 

This is a regression as it doesn't occur in 5.1
fields.summary: SC Investigate modal window: issues with filters on Events tab 'Checker' pane

comments.body:
This does seem slow. An strace of the call appears to show it parsing through all the time files to get data.

I know that Farhan had updated nfdump for ubuntu16 support and my guess is that this has caused this issue.

There was a "-g" flag used to limit the amount of data that was read. I've transferred an old 5.1 nfdump to this server and run it with same parameters and I get different data (probably because the nfcapd files are different), but when I run without -g, it takes much longer:

{code}
root@spj-ubuntu16-dbregression:~# time /tmp/nfdump -M /var/opt/opsview/netflow/data/27 -R .  -o csv -s record/bytes -n 10 2>&1 | wc -l 
64922725

real	5m59.684s
user	1m36.688s
sys	3m12.944s
{code}

Versus with the -g flag:

{code}
root@spj-ubuntu16-dbregression:~# time /tmp/nfdump -M /var/opt/opsview/netflow/data/27 -R . -g 1470124980:1470125040 -o csv -s record/bytes -n 10 2>&1 | wc -l
24331

real	0m0.124s
user	0m0.048s
sys	0m0.072s
{code}

Using the new binary, get different timings:
{code}
root@spj-ubuntu16-dbregression:~# time /usr/local/nagios/bin/nfdump -M /var/opt/opsview/netflow/data/27 -R . -g 1470124980:1470125040 -o csv -s record/bytes -n 10 2>&1 | wc -l
14

real	0m26.406s
user	0m13.252s
sys	0m0.896s
{code}

{code}
root@spj-ubuntu16-dbregression:~# time /usr/local/nagios/bin/nfdump -M /var/opt/opsview/netflow/data/27 -R .  -o csv -s record/bytes -n 10 2>&1 | wc -l
14

real	0m16.698s
user	0m12.684s
sys	0m0.844s
{code}

So it looks like the use of -g makes it slower than normal. My guess is that something has changed that invalidates the -g changes, which needs investigation by backend team.

fields.description:
SSH tunnel failure to slave when performing a system reload... It does appear to restart straight away though. Please see the attached excerpt from the opsviewd.log.

********************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************

There is a similar but separate issue that has been seen, on RHEL 7 and Centos 7, where after adding a slave monitoring server with an invalid configuration, doing a reload (the reload failing as expected), doing a restore to the point before the slave monitoring server was added, and then doing a reload causes the reload to keep permanently reloading. This is possibly due to the fact that the slave monitoring server is still in the runtime database therefore the new config isn't picked up; doing an opsview_watchdog all stop, all start seems to fix the issue which would lend more weight to this theory. 


Please see the log file attached named 'reload_issue_opsviewd_output' which gives the output of the opsviewd.log from the point at which the restore is carried out, reported in the log as being 

[2016/08/02 08:10:21] [opsviewd] [main::cmd_exec:453] [INFO] Executing command: db_restore_web /usr/local/nagios/var/backups/opsview-db-33.sql.gz 33
fields.summary: SSH tunnel failure to slave when performing a system reload...

fields.description:
Mismatch between documentation and actual re. the duration options in the investigation modal...

The documentation states -  Last 1 min, Last 2 mins, Last 5 mins, Last 10 mins and Last 20 mins

The actual varies depending on what the duration is set to in 'Graph Settings' -  

* If 'graph settings' duration is set to 1, 3, 6 or 12 hour(s).... Then the duration options in the investigation modal are -  Last 1 min, Last 2 mins, Last 5 mins and Last 10 mins
* If 'graph settings' duration is set to 1 day.... Then the duration options in the investigation modal are -  Last 1 min, Last 2 mins, Last 5 mins, Last 10 mins' and 'Last 20 mins

fields.description:
The selenium tests are using page size element name PerPageCombo to identify the element uniquely on most of the pages for settings tests. Old build:
<input id="combobox-1358-inputEl" class="x-form-field x-form-text" type="text" name="PerPageCombo" value="100" autocomplete="off" spellcheck="false" role="combobox" data-errorqtip="" style="width: 100%;"/>

New build:
<input id="combobox-1066-inputEl" class="x-form-field x-form-text x-trigger-noedit" type="text" readonly="readonly" name="combobox-1066-inputEl" value="50" autocomplete="off" spellcheck="false" role="combobox" data-errorqtip="" style="width: 100%;"/>

fields.description:
In DashboardNG-5.2, a defect was raised where a validation error of one object in the boxselect list was not highlighting the overall field. See DRP-973

To reproduce:
  * In event table dashlet, add two hosts. Save
  * In Opsview, delete one of the hosts
  * An error should be raised about the missing host, but is not visible

The boxselect plugin we are using is from https://github.com/kveeiv/extjs-boxselect. This is in navigation/app/ux. It seems there are pull requests that fix this precise issue: https://github.com/kveeiv/extjs-boxselect/pull/31. Specifically https://github.com/kveeiv/extjs-boxselect/pull/31/commits/8fbdbc8f7195b62d428fee8af74ab9541dd522d6

However, the boxselect.css seems a bit messy. It appears to be included in packages/Hermes/resources/css/dashboard.css and packages/Hermes/resources/css/settings.css

Scope of this defect is:
  * Review and merge the CSS into navigation.css with appropriate comments
  * Review the changes in the pull request
  * Merge changes in
  * Test the original defect

fields.description:
Customer raised issue: process map stores its height as a percent of its width. However, if the width is very large and thus the height is large, then scrolling is required to view the entire background. See attached image.

Proposal is that the height is the minimum of the calculated height of the dashlet or the available height. This would have the effect of "squashing" the height of the dashlet.

The backend state of the dashlet remains as a percent and is not changed, until the user moves the dashlet height in which case a new percent value will be calculated for saving.

Acceptance criteria:
  * No scroll bar appears for the process map dashlet (it is acceptable to get a scrollbar if the dashlet is not the top one in a dashboard)
  * The positions of the icons adjust automatically to the new height (these are saved as a percent of the location on the dashlet)
  * Changing the size of the browser adjusts the height of the dashlet appropriately
  * The backend information of the dashlet height percent does not change until the user changes the height of the dashlet

I'm expecting this to only be a few lines at the time of calculating the height of the dashlet.
fields.summary: Process Map: autoheight calculations to not exceed current browser height

comments.body:
I think this is a performance issue related to the REST calls taking too long. However, there seems to be inconsistency based on data since some of the calls take as long as 14s while some are completed in under 1s. Refer attachment DRP-283..GIF for details.
Assigning this to Craig to decide on how to progress on this.

Scott says this is invoked by pressing the +1 button multiple times. I'm assuming each press causes a REST API call to be made. If the backend is receiving a lot of calls, then it would cause a slow response.

The fix would be to disable the buttons in the front end when a press occurs and to re-enable when the response is received (or maybe a load mask over the entire window).

However, Craig says this is one for the backlog.

fields.description:
On the Performance Gauge config window, there seems to be some issues with selecting a service check after having chosen a host, then choosing metrics from there, and attempting to add a different service check of the host. 

Here are the steps to reproduce the issue: 

1) Drag and drop the Performance Gauge dashlet on to the dashboard 

2) Click on the config icon of the dashlet 

3) Select a host (who you know to have more than 1 service check) in the host field

4) Select a service check in the service check field  

5) Select a metric in the metrics field 

6) In the service check field, attempt to add a different service check

Expected Result: After step 6, it should be possible to add a different service check. 

Actual Result: After step 6, it is not possible to add a different service check. 

This has initially been seen with build 5.2.0.161331301, on Firefox 46.0.1, on Windows 10, on rhel 7.

fields.description:
Cannot manually remove acknowledgement for acknowledged host that is "down" or "unreachable" on "Investigate" screen on host.

Requires unhandled down or unreachable host.
On host, from hamburger select "Mass acknowledgement".
Tick the 1 "down" box for that host (only available selection) and enter some text as comment.
Shortly after Opsview moves host to "handled" section.
Find said host, select "Investigate" from hamburger.
On the info tab (default), 4th line click on "Acknowledged [trash can symbol]".
Click yes to confirmation.
Error - Opsview Web Exception - "No objects chosen for acknowledgements".
fields.summary: Cannot remove acknowledgement from a host

fields.description:
When the Host/Service/Keyword is deleted, it appears as a cross (X) on the Process Map dashlet with a tooltip '<Name> is deleted'.
However, opening the edit window neither displays a message that the Host/Service/Keyword is deleted nor it removes it from the dropdown. Saving the deleted Host/Service/Keyword is still possible unlike other dashlets where Save is not allowed until a new Host/Service/Keyword is selected.
Refer attachment for details.

Steps:
1.Go to http://10.0.2.204/dashboard/ and drag a Process Map dashlet.
2. Add a Host/Service/Keyword.
3.Delete it from Core.
4.A cross with a deleted tooltip should be displayed.
5.Open the edit window and observe the results.
fields.summary: DSHB - Process Map, Host/Service/Keyword listed in the edit window after deletion.

fields.description:
For BSM Service or Component, when the investigate window is being displayed and the particular Service or Component is deleted from Core, after clicking Refresh at the top instead of displaying a 'Data not available' message, the Services and Components are still displayed.
Also, after pinning the same investigate window to Dashboard and opening the config window, instead of the name the '$1' is mentioned in the message "Following component(s) deleted from Opsview Core : $1".
Refer attachment for details.

Steps:
1.Go to http://10.0.2.204/dashboard/ and navigate to BSM dashlets.
2.Drag the BSM service or Component dashlet and open the Investigate window for it.
3.Navigate to Core on another tab and delete the particular Component or Service.
4.Navigate back and click refresh inside the Investigate window.
5.Observe the results.
6.Now pin the tab and open its Config window.
7.Observe the message at the top.
fields.summary: DSHB - BSM dashlets, investigate window does not display the 'Data not available' message

fields.description:
After a Host/Service is deleted from Settings app following issues are observed. Refer attachment for details.

*Dashboard*
1. Instead of 'Series Deleted', the message being displayed is 'No Source Available'.
2. The 'Current data' dropdown on the bottom LHS is missing.

*Config*
1. No error message is being displayed at the top of config window indicating the Host/Service is deleted.A message like ' The following services have been removed from Opsview: Unix Swap1' should be displayed at the top.
2. The Host/Service field is not empty despite the value being deleted.
3. The Save button when clicked when Host/Service is deleted closes the config window. Instead the Host/Service field should be highlighted with a message ' Please enter values in highlighted fields.' at the top.

Steps:
1.Go to http://10.0.2.201/dashboard/ and drag & drop the Metric Pie Chart NG dashlet.
2.Open Config & set the Host/Service & click Save.
3.Delete the Host/Service & Reload.
4.Navigate back & observe the view on the Dashboard & Cinfig.
5.Repeat the above steps for Metric Pie Chart dashlet and compare.
fields.summary: DSHB - Metric Pie Chart, multiple issues after Host/Service deletion

fields.description:
Ubuntu16 install fails to abort when sql_mode not selected to be disabled...  Please see the attached log.

During the install process the following option appears -

2016-08-09 11:54:38 Checking MySQL Global Variables
mysql: [Warning] Using a password on the command line interface can be insecure.
sql_mode is set to strict, do you wish to disable sql_mode? [y/N] n
2016-08-09 11:54:46 Cannot continue the autoinstall setup as we need to disable strict sql_mode.\n Please disable strict manually and try again.
2016-08-09 11:54:46 - Upgrading your system
Extracting templates from packages: 100%

If 'No' is selected then the script advises that it cannot continue... However it does until the point where it advises that it is activating Opsview where it hangs -

Module proxy_http already enabled
[ ok ] Restarting apache2 (via systemctl): apache2.service.
2016-08-09 11:58:17 - Setting up environment
2016-08-09 11:58:17 - Activating Opsview

This is obviously incorrect... It should exit immediately after the 'N' option is given.

Scalability Pack - 
Store monitoring data on a dedicated database server or extend the reach of Opsview Pro's service assurance to datacenters in other geographic locations using its native slave server monitoring capabilities. 

Reports Pack -
Our robust reporting engine gives you unparalleled visibility into the performance of your IT infrastructure. More than 30 out-of-the-box reporting templates let you automate reporting on key metrics such as service level availability and cost of downtime.

Network Analyzer -
Allows for the monitoring and analysis of NetFlow, jFlow and sFlow data from Cisco, HP and other network vendors. Gives terrific insight into network health and bandwidth usage. 

Extra Support Pack -
Adds five extra support tickets to your Pro subscription support entitlement.

fields.description:
When the Host/Service/Keyword is deleted, it appears as a cross (X) on the Process Map dashlet with a tooltip '<Name> is deleted'.
However, opening the edit window neither displays a message that the Host/Service/Keyword is deleted nor it removes it from the dropdown. Saving the deleted Host/Service/Keyword is still possible unlike other dashlets where Save is not allowed until a new Host/Service/Keyword is selected.
Refer attachment for details.

Steps:
1.Go to http://10.0.2.204/dashboard/ and drag a Process Map dashlet.
2. Add a Host/Service/Keyword.
3.Delete it from Core.
4.A cross with a deleted tooltip should be displayed.
5.Open the edit window and observe the results.

fields.description:
Found during testing of DRP-434.

When the Process map has a refresh, it fires off multiple ajax calls. See https://secure.opsview.com/confluence/display/ENG/Process+Map#ProcessMap-ProcessMapDashletLoad for a diagram.

However, there is no provision for failures. If any one of the calls fails, then there is no response and the dashlet refresh button stays in a disabled state.

This story is to improve this. One possibility is to update the refresh timer tooltip to have a countdown of each call and when all finished, then throw the error.
fields.summary: Process Map: handle error conditions better

fields.description:
Attempting to access the config window by clicking the config icon on the old Event Table dashlet results in the following error being generated in the console:

This has been seen intially with commercial-dashboardNG-5.2 build 5.2.0.161271530, on Firefox version 46.0.1, on debian 8 (and also on rhel 7), on Windows 10. 

Please see screenshot attached.

<input id="combobox-1358-inputEl" class="x-form-field x-form-text" type="text" name="PerPageCombo" value="100" autocomplete="off" spellcheck="false" role="combobox" data-errorqtip="" style="width: 100%;"/>

Initially identified during the Dashboard Phase 3 to 5 UAT, on the config window of the Top 10 Service Issues dashlet, for the 'Warning threshold:' and 'Critical threshold:' fields, it is not immediately clear to the user the values they need to enter for these fields; the values used are duration values and the default is 1 day.

Please see screenshot attached. 

Please just add a "Day" Label at the end of these lines

4.Observe the result.

After changes to postinstall_root, the script is no longer idempotent.

Running this script more than once is fairly common.
